title: Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Treatment Centers
name: Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Treatment Centers
description: Treatment centers for traumatic brain injury and/or spinal cord injury in the United States.

properties.name: Gaylord Hospital
properties.description:
Gaylord Hospital is a 109-bed facility that specializes in the care and treatment of both brain and spinal cord injury patients. The mission of Gaylord is to provide specialized care to each patient using an interdisciplinary team comprising physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals.
Gaylord has recently partnered with Boston Medical Center to become one of the country’s 14 Model Spinal Cord Injury System Centers.
Gaylord Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Craig Hospital
properties.description:
Craig Hospital is a 93-bed rehabilitation center that specializes in specialty rehabilitation and research for people with brain and spinal cord injury. Craig Hospital is designated by the National Institute on Disability Rehabilitation and Research (NIDRR) as a Model System Center for both spinal cord and brain injury, and has been names one of the top ten rehabilitation centers in the United States by U.S. News & World Report, since the list began.
Craig promotes an interdisciplinary approach that involves physicians, nurses, physical therapists, occupational therapists, counselors, recreation specialists, psychologists, dieticians, speech and language pathologists, neuropsychologists, and respiratory therapists. Treatment is highly individualized based on the patients needs. In addition, one of the most highly regarded benefits of experiencing rehabilitation at Craig Hospital is the opportunity for patients and families of similar ages, backgrounds, and injuries to teach, encourage, and support one another. Craig has the distinction of having treated more spinal cord injury patients than any other facility in the world.
Craig Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Pinecrest Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Pinecrest Rehabilitation Hospital is a 90-bed center that features inpatient programs for survivors of both spinal cord and brain injury. The hospital provides treatment and rehabilitation management services, as well as advanced technology, to a diverse group of patients.
The mission of the brain injury program is to provide an environment in which survivors can reach maximum function and independence in physical, psychosocial, and cognitive activities. Each individual’s medical, physical, cognitive, and behavioral situation is taken into consideration, before a unique and individualized program is planned.
The spinal cord injury program provides care to those who have been in accidents, as well as those who are experiencing spinal cord issues as a result of disease or illness. Patients can expect to learn how to return to productivity and independence, how to compensate for certain lack of function, and how to participate in leisure activities.
Pinecrest Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Southeastern Regional Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
Southwestern Regional Rehabilitation Center is a 78-bed facility located at the Cape Fear Valley Medical Center in Fayetteville. The facility provides rehabilitation services for children and adults with brain and spinal cord injury, which include physical and occupational therapy, speech and language pathology, recreational therapy, psychology, counseling, vocational evaluation and back-to-work rehabilitation, wound management, and aquatic therapy.
Southeaster Regional Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: The Rehabilitation Center at Santa Clara Valley Medical Center
properties.description: In more than 30 years of providing rehab services, the Rehabilitation Center at Santa Clara Valley Medical Center has treated more than 10,000 patients with spinal cord and brain injuries. In addition to providing state-of-the-art technology and services, the center also does research and has contributed greatly to what we know today about brain and spinal cord injury. The facility includes 76 beds and has a staff comprising physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals. About 150 people are treated in the spinal cord program each year, which contributes to the center’s specialized skills and experience. The Rehabilitation Center promotes an integrated approach to care, which means the medical team works in conjunction with the patient and his or her family to ensure that optimal gains are made. The Rehabilitation Center at Santa Clara Valley Medical Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 751 South Bascom Avenue, San Jose, CA 95128

properties.name: Banner Good Samaritan Rehabilitation Institute
properties.description: The Banner Good Samaritan Rehabilitation Institute, located at the Banner Good Samaritan Medical Center in Phoenix, AZ, has been one of the Southwest’s leading rehabilitation centers for the last 40 years. The institute, which accepts patients with catastrophic brain and spinal cord injuries, has 63 beds and a staff that comprises physiatrists (doctors who specialize in rehabilitation medicine), nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals.In addition to its inpatient center, Good Samaritan also has neuroscience clinics and an outpatient rehab service that helps patients with wheelchair mobility, wheelchair seating, adapted driving, speech and vocal chord therapy, and balance disorders.Good Samaritan also participates in research, and was involved in two studies that allowed paraplegic men to walk with assistive devices.The Banner Good Samaritan Rehabilitation Institute is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Tampa General Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
The 59-bed Tampa General Rehabilitation Center is located on the Tampa General Hospital Campus. The center treats spinal cord and brain injured adults and children, and is designated as a Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Program by the Florida Department of Health.
An integrated, multidisciplinary approach is the focus, so that patients can achieve their full potential. Family members are encouraged to work alongside the medical team in the rehabilitation process.
The Tampa General Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Cottage Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description: The Cottage Rehabilitation Hospital, formerly known as the Rehabilitation Institute at Santa Barbara, is a 38-bed center that provides comprehensive medical care to those with catastrophic injury and illness, including brain and spinal cord injury survivors. The Cottage Rehabilitation Hospital strives to address the medical, physical, cognitive, psychological, and family issues of each and every patient using a team of interdisciplinary physicians, nurses, and therapists. All treatment is individualized and age appropriate. Every patient is assigned a case manager who coordinates the care plan and also assists with any social and economic problems that may arise as the result of the injury. Cottage Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 2415 De La Vina, Santa Barbara, CA 93105-3819

properties.name: Stanford Hospital and Clinics
properties.description: Recognized as a top rehabilitation center by U.S. News & World Report, the Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Clinic at Stanford uses a team approach to brain and spinal cord injury patient care. Physicians are experienced physiatrists (physicians who are board certified in rehabilitative medicine) with sub-specialties in the rehabilitation of specific injuries. The inpatient clinic has 17 beds and provides comprehensive diagnosis, treatment, and management of both brain and spinal cord injury. The Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Clinic at Stanford is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: University of Colorado Hospital
properties.description:
The University of Colorado Hospital is consistently ranked as one of the best rehabilitation hospitals in the United States, and is known for its top-quality medical staff and progressive treatment plans. The center is the only academic center in the region, blending research and care with teaching.
The inpatient facility is a small, 12-bed facility that provides highly individualized care by an interdisciplinary team. Patients at the University of Colorado Hospital have access to physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals.
The University of Colorado Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Hook Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Hook Rehabilitation Center is an 84-bed facility that treats a variety of physical and cognitive disabilities, including those that result from brain and spinal cord injury.
The Hook Brain Injury Unit has 12 beds devoted to two different treatment programs—brain injury rehabilitation and neurobehavioral rehabilitation. The rehabilitation program focuses on physical and cognitive rehabilitation, while the neurobehavioral program focuses on the less acute cognitive and behavioral issues that often prevent patients from being independent.
The Hook Rehabilitation Unit recently integrated the NESS L300TM neuron-rehabilitation system, which helps those with both traumatic brain injury and incomplete spinal cord injury regain some lost mobility.
Hook Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: The West Florida Rehabilitation Institute at West Florida Healthcare
properties.description:
The West Florida Rehabilitation Institute, which is licensed by the Florida Department of Health and Rehabilitation Services, is the only facility that offers brain and spinal cord injury rehabilitation in the Pensacola area.
In addition to striving to ensure that all patients return to maximum independence in all areas, the institute has a comprehensive family education program that allows parents, siblings, and other individuals important to the survivor to take part in and support the rehabilitation process.
The brain injury unit comprises 10 beds, while the spinal cord injury unit comprises 16 beds. The institute is designated a Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Center by by the State of Florida.
The West Florida Rehabilitation Institute is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: CareMeridian, Oxnard
properties.description: CareMeridian provides a continuum of high quality, cost-effective post-acute care and rehabilitation options to people of all ages with brain, spinal cord and other life-altering injuries and medically-complex illnesses. With program locations throughout the Western United States, CareMeridian offers a distinctive service delivery model, merging an experienced and skilled health care and rehabilitation team with state-of-the-art technology in community-based program settings designed to meet the unique needs of those we serve at every stage of their recovery. Patients are provided for in an atmosphere that is residential, and includes individually decorated rooms, a fully equipped kitchen, entertainment areas, and an outdoor area. In addition to its home-like atmosphere, CareMeridian also provides the most current and state-of-the-art technology and service. The staff is trained in treating medically complex situations, such as those that require IV infusion services and ventilator/tracheotomy support. With 24-hour physician and rehabilitation care, CareMeridian also offers rehabilitation therapy services, nutritional services, and pharmacy, lab, radiology, and medical equipment services. The staff is trained in treating medically complex situations, such as those that require IV infusion services and ventilator/tracheotomy support. CareMeridian has four locations in Northern California, including Granite Bay, Sacramento, Marin and Gilroy; two locations in Central California, including Fresno- Weber and Fresno-Marks; and 14 locations in Southern California. CareMeridian has earned has earned a Gold Seal of Approval from the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Standards (JCAHO), and is accredited by the Commission on the Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Helen Hayes Hospital Center for Rehabilitation Technology
properties.description: The Helen Hayes Hospital Center for Rehabilitation Technology provides physical rehabilitation for patients with both brain and spinal cord injury. The center’s focus is on using cutting-edge equipment and technology to restore as much function as possible to patients, allowing them to live active, productive, and independent lives. Every patient receives an individual plan that is developed by the physician and shared with the family and caregivers. Specialists that may be involved in the patient’s care include physical therapists, occupational therapists, respiratory therapists, speech pathologists, nurses, nutritionists, social workers, and prosthetists and orthotists.  Helen Hayes Hospital Center also plays a major role in research, and is committed to contributing to the cures of the illnesses and injuries they deal with.  Helen Hayes Hospital Center is operated by the New York State Department of Health and is affiliated with the New York-Presbytarian Healthcare System. It is is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: National Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
The National Rehabilitation Hospital, which has been rated by physicians for more than 14 years as one of the country’s top rehabilitation hospitals in U.S. News & World Report, specializes in treating patients with both brain and spinal cord injuries. The rehabilitation team comprises board-certified physicians, physical and occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, vocational rehabilitation counselors, and other clinicians. Through highly individualized programs, patients have access to the most cutting edge equipment and assistive technology.
In addition to providing patient care, National Rehabilitation Hospital also participates in rehabilitation research and education and training of rehabilitation professionals and the community. In addition, the center has a strong strong commitment to patient advocacy, and makes an effort to work with their patients to ensure that policymakers are aware of their needs.
The National Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: University of Washington Medical Center Department of Rehabilitation Medicine
properties.description:
The University of Washington Department of Rehabilitation Medicine is dedicated to improving the function and independence and quality of life of people with spinal cord injury. In addition to patient care, the department is a leader in education and training, research, and patient advocacy.
The center is home to the Northwest Regional Spinal Cord Injury System, which is one of 14 model spinal cord injury centers designated by NIDRR.
University of Washington Medical Center Department of Rehabilitation Medicine is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Magee Rehabilitation
properties.description:
Magee Rehabilitation offers programs for spinal cord and brain injured patients that focus on maximum return to function and independence. In addition, they are also leaders when it comes to education and research.
Magee’s spinal cord injury program, which is run in partnership with Thomas Jefferson University Hospital, is a federally designated model system of care. Using cutting-edge technology and assistive devices, the goal is to help patients adapt and function to the best of their ability. Magee’s Lifetime Follow-Up System of Care ensures that patients and their families have access to help with issues and challenges that crop up after long-term care ends.
The main goal of the brain injury program, which is also run in partnership with Thomas Jefferson University Hospital, is to ensure that patients are able to function to the best of their ability at home, at work, in school, and in other community settings. Realizing that all brain injuries manifest themselves in different ways, each patient’s treatment play is individualized.
Magee Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is an inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
Those who have suffered from stroke have access to specially trained staff at HealthSouth’s Stroke Rehabilitation Center of Excellence. HealthSouth hospitals that receive this designation have exceeded benchmarks in clinical programming and patient outcomes for the treatment of stroke.
HealthSouth is also known for using some of the most advanced rehabilitation technology for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
In addition to the facility in Largo, HealthSouth also has brain and spinal cord injury rehabilitation centers in Tallahassee and Fort Lauderdale. All three of these centers are accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Penn State Hershey Rehabilitation
properties.description: Located at the Milton S. Hershey Medical Center College of Medicine, Penn State Hershey Rehabilitation provides services for patients with both brain and spinal cord injury. The rehabilitation team includes physiatrists, physicians, nurses, therapists, psychologists, case managers, and care coordinators. Penn State Hershey Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 2501 N. 3rd Street, 2nd Floor Memorial, Harrisburg, PA 17110

properties.name: Miller-Dwan Medical Center
properties.description:
Miller-Dwan Medical Center treats brain and spinal cord injury at an inpatient basis, with an emphasis on active participation of the patient. The patient, as well as his or her family, are involved in all aspects of the rehabilitation process, from making goals to monitoring progress.
Using an interdisciplinary team that focuses on individual treatment based on needs and goals, services at Miller-Dwan include physical and occupational therapy, therapeutic recreation, speech and language pathology, psychology, peer counseling, nutrition services, continence services, and patient/family education.
Miller-Dwan Medical Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Center for Rehabilitation
properties.description:
The Center for Rehabilitation is located at the Boston Medical Center, and treats patients with a wide variety of illnesses and injuries, including brain and spinal cord injury. The program combines state-of-the-art medical equipment and an interdisciplinary team to develop individualized programs designed to return the patient the maximum amount of function possible.
The New England Regional Spinal Cord Injury Center is located at the Center for Rehabilitation, and has been designated one of the National Model Systems Spinal Cord Injury Treatment Centers. It is also one of seven facilities in the country—the only one in New England—that has been named a member of the Christopher Reeve Foundation NeuroRecovery Network, a network of centers who strive to provide, develop, and test cutting-edge rehabilitation therapies for those living with paralysis.
The Center for Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: One Boston Medical Center Place, Boston, MA 02118

properties.name: Rehabilitation Center at The Good Samaritan Hospital of Maryland
properties.description:
The Rehabilitation Center at The Good Samaritan Hospital of Maryland partners with John Hopkins University School of Medicine in the treatment of spinal cord injury. Care is highly individualized according to the patient’s particular needs, and is coordinated by a case manager.
The Spinal Cord Injury program focuses on returning patients to the community with as much independence as possible, using an interdisciplinary team that includes the patient’s family. In addition to helping the patient cope physically, the program also focuses on the mental coping skills that each patient needs following catastrophic injury.
The Rehabilitation Center at the Good Samaritan Hospital of Maryland is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Jackson Memorial Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
Jackson Memorial Rehabilitation Center provides both inpatient and outpatient services to a wide variety of patients, including those with all levels of brain and spinal cord injury. Patients span all ages, from adults to children.
Jackson’s patients are the recipients of individualized care furnished by a multidisciplinary team made up of doctors, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, recreational therapists, counselors, and psychiatrists. The goal of the program, working together with both the patient and his or her family, it to return the patient to the maximum amount of function and independence in the shortest period of time.
Jackson Memorial Rehabilitation Center is also the home of the South Florida Regional Spinal Cord Injury Model System. This center is a collaborative effort between the University of Miami School of Medicine, the Miama Project to Cure Paralysis, Jackson Memorial Hospital, and the Miami VA Medical Center.
Jackson Memorial Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Shands Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Shands Rehabilitation Center has met he standards and criteria allowing it to be designated by the Florida Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Program.
The multidisplinary team at Shands develops an individualized program for every patient, focusing on helping people return to function and improve the quality of their lives, while at the same time learning how to deal with the effects of a recent catastrophic injury.
Shands is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital of Southern Arizona
properties.description: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is an inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.Those who have suffered from stroke have access to specially trained staff at HealthSouth’s Stroke Rehabilitation Center of Excellence. HealthSouth hospitals that receive this designation have exceeded benchmarks in clinical programming and patient outcomes for the treatment of stroke.HealthSouth is also known for using some of the most advanced rehabilitation technology for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.The HealthSouth facility in Tucson is only one facility of many in Arizona that helps brain and spinal cord injury patients. Additional facilities are located in Glendale, Scottsdale, and Yuma (at the associated Yuma Rehabilitation Hospital).To find additional information on the above HealthSouth facilities in Arizona, log on to HealthSouth’s website and use their “facility locator” under the “where we are” tab.Certification and accreditation may vary according to location. Please check with the hospital administrator to determine exact certifications.

properties.name: Baylor Institute for Rehabilitation
properties.description:
Baylor Institute for Rehabilitation is the main campus for the Baylor Rehabilitation System, a network of hospitals located throughout the Dallas metro area. Named 12 times as one of the country’s best rehabilitation hospitals by U.S. News & World Report, Baylor has specialized rehabilitation teams for brain and spinal cord injured patients.
The Traumatic Brain Injury Program has been designated a Model System by NIDRR, and is a cooperative effort between Baylor Institute for Rehabilitation, Baylor University Medical Center, and the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center. This program also allows patients to enroll in research which may improve the future outcomes of people who have sustained traumatic brain injury.
The Spinal Cord Injury Program provides an interdisciplinary team including board-certified physiatrists, nurses, licensed physical and occupational therapists, recreation therapists, social workers, psychologists, and care coordinators. Services include spinal cord education classes, counseling on sexuality, day and evening outings, patient and family member education, peer support groups, aquatic therapy, adaptive driving, and help with assistive devices.
Baylor Institute for Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: CareMeridian, Escondido
properties.description: CareMeridian provides a continuum of high quality, cost-effective post-acute care and rehabilitation options to people of all ages with brain, spinal cord and other life-altering injuries and medically-complex illnesses. With program locations throughout the Western United States, CareMeridian offers a distinctive service delivery model, merging an experienced and skilled health care and rehabilitation team with state-of-the-art technology in community-based program settings designed to meet the unique needs of those we serve at every stage of their recovery. Patients are provided for in an atmosphere that is residential, and includes individually decorated rooms, a fully equipped kitchen, entertainment areas, and an outdoor area. In addition to its home-like atmosphere, CareMeridian also provides the most current and state-of-the-art technology and service. The staff is trained in treating medically complex situations, such as those that require IV infusion services and ventilator/tracheotomy support. With 24-hour physician and rehabilitation care, CareMeridian also offers rehabilitation therapy services, nutritional services, and pharmacy, lab, radiology, and medical equipment services. The staff is trained in treating medically complex situations, such as those that require IV infusion services and ventilator/tracheotomy support. CareMeridian has four locations in Northern California, including Granite Bay, Sacramento, Marin and Gilroy; two locations in Central California, including Fresno- Weber and Fresno-Marks; and 14 locations in Southern California. CareMeridian has earned has earned a Gold Seal of Approval from the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Standards (JCAHO), and is accredited by the Commission on the Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center
properties.description: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is an inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.Those who have suffered from stroke have access to specially trained staff at HealthSouths Stroke Rehabilitation Center of Excellence. HealthSouth hospitals that receive this designation have exceeded benchmarks in clinical programming and patient outcomes for the treatment of stroke.HealthSouth is also known for using some of the most advanced rehabilitation technology for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.While the HealthSouth facility in Birmingham is the home of the company's headquarters, there are several facilities located throughout the region that specialize in certain types of injuries. In addition to Montgomery, there are brain injury facilities in Montgomery, Phenix City, Dothan, Gadsden and Huntsville. Spinal cord injuries can be treated in Dothan, Gadsden, and Huntsville. Some, but not all of the HealthSouth facilities are accredited by the Commission on the Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF). You can find out if the ones you are considering are accredited by asking the hospital administrator.

properties.name: University of Alabama at Birmingham
properties.description: The University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation is home both a Spinal Cord Injury Model Sytem Center and a Traumatic Brain Injury Model System Center. Located in the renowned Spain Rehabilitation Center, both the brain and spinal cord programs offer advanced, individual care to a diverse population. Staff includes physiatrists (doctors who specialize in rehabilitation medicine), nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals.As a Model System Centers, both the brain and spinal cord programs share the latest brain and spinal cord injury research and methods of treatment with other clinical research programs.In addition, the UAB program fosters an atmosphere in which survivors and their families work together to heal and recover. In an effort to help families care for the patient upon return home, each patients family is included in therapy education sessions.The UAB program is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Long Beach Memorial Rehabilitation Center
properties.description: The Long Beach Memorial Rehabilitation Center, located at the Long Beach Memorial Hospital, has brain and spinal cord injury rehabilitation programs for adults at its Long Beach campus. The Brain Injury Program boasts specialized programs for people with all types and levels of injury, ranging from the Sensory Stimulation Program for seriously brain injured patients at the beginning of the recovery process, to the Brain Injury Program that focuses on wellness and community integration. The Spasticity Clinic, Balance and Vestibular Center, and Outpatient Neuro-Rehabilitation are also unique. The Spinal Cord Injury Program is designed to help patients reach the maximum level of independence possible, and is the only facility in Southern California to perform the advanced surgical technique of upper extremity electrical implants known as the “Freehand” system. The Miller Children’s Hospital, which offers brain and spinal cord injury rehabilitation for children, is also located at the Long Beach Memorial Hospital in Long Beach. The Long Beach Memorial Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: CareMeridian, Artesia

properties.name: St. Jude Medical Centers for Rehabilitation
properties.description: Spinal cord injury and brain injury are two of the areas of expertise at St. Jude’s rehabilitation facility. Geared specifically toward children, the programs advocate hope and healing in a supportive environment. Patient care is highly specialized depending upon the injury, and all patients have access to a wide variety of programs including physical therapy, occupational therapy, education and support groups, audiology services, and speech therapy. In an effort to help patients gain as much independence as possible, structured therapy programs that include clinics, coordinated home services, and community re-entry services are part of the care package offered. The St. Jude Medical Centers for Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 101 E. Valencia Mesa Dr., Fullerton, CA 92835

properties.name: Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center
properties.description: Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center’s highly qualified staff, level of care, and newest technology have earned it a spot in U.S. News & World Report’s list of “America’s Best Hospitals 2008” for Rehabilitation for several years running. Rancho Los Amigos features 20 Centers of Excellence, including one for spinal cord injury and another for adult brain injury. Both centers feature an interdisciplinary team comprising physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals. Because one in three residents of Los Angeles County speak Spanish, Rancho Los Amigos has expanded its Video Medical Interpreter system, allowing patients who have limited English proficiency to easily access interpreter services. Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

Patients receive three hours of therapy at least five days a week, and more than 6 hours of licensed nursing care per day. Casa Colina offers its renowned Signature Program, in which each and every patient receives and individualized program, in both brain and spinal cord injury. properties.name: The Center for Rehabilitation Medicine at Northridge Hospital Medical Center
properties.description: The Center for Rehabilitation Medicine at Northridge Hospital Medical Center specializes in treating those with catastrophic or debilitation injury, including brain and spinal cord injury patients. Care is individualized and may include a combination of physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and psychology. Driver preparedness, a return to work program, and community re-orientation outings are also part of the program. The Center for the Rehabilitation Medicine at Northridge Hospital Medical Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital at Fort Smith
properties.description: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is an inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.Those who have suffered from stroke have access to specially trained staff at HealthSouth’s Stroke Rehabilitation Center of Excellence. HealthSouth hospitals that receive this designation have exceeded benchmarks in clinical programming and patient outcomes for the treatment of stroke.HealthSouth is also known for using some of the most advanced rehabilitation technology for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.The HealthSouth facility in Fort Smith is only one facility of several in Arkansas that help brain and spinal cord injury patients. Additional facilities are located in Fayetteville, Jonesboro, and Sherwood (in conjunction with Catholic Health Initiatives).To find additional information on the above HealthSouth facilities in Arkansas, log on to HealthSouth’s website and use their “facility locator” under the “where we are” tab.Certification and accreditation may vary according to location. Please check with the hospital administrator to determine exact certifications.

properties.name: Lovelace Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description: Lovelace Rehabilitation Hospital includes services for both brain injured and spinal cord injured patients. The specialized environment allows each patient to be treated individually by a certified and specialized staff, and is designed to help patients reach their goal of recovering the maximum amount of function possible. Families are considered an integral part of the recovery team, and are encouraged to participate in the patient’s treatment program. Lovelance Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Center on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Barnes Jewish Hospital
properties.description:
Barnes Jewish Hospital, in partnership with the Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis, offers a neurological rehabilitation program that accepts patients with brain and spinal cord injury.
All programs are individualized based on patient need, and in addition to returning to maximum function may include assistance with daily activities, speech therapy, bladder and bowel retraining, stress and depression management, mobility and exercise programs, social and behavioral skills retraining, nutritional counseling, and vocational counseling. In all programs, families are encouraged to be a part of the patient’s interdisciplinary team.
Barnes Jewish Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF). In addition, it is frequently listed by U.S. News & World Report as one of the best hospitals in the United States.

properties.description: CareMeridian provides a continuum of high quality, cost-effective post-acute care and rehabilitation options to people of all ages with brain, spinal cord and other life-altering injuries and medically-complex illnesses.
