properties.address: 7150 Sierra Ponds Ln., Granite Bay, CA 95746

properties.name: Rusk Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
Rusk Rehabilitation Center is a partnership between University of Missouri Healthcare and HealthSouth. In addition to treatment focused on limiting disability, promoting independence, and restoring function, Rusk Rehabilitation Center also participates in research and education.
Rusk features both a Spinal Cord Injury Program and a Brain Injury Program. In both programs, therapy is individualized and provided by a multidisciplinary team comprising physiatrists, rehabilitation nurses, case managers, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, respiratory therapists, and neuropsychologists.
Rusk Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Spalding Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Spalding offers inpatient rehabilitation programs for both brain and spinal cord injury patients, with a focus on individualized and interdisciplinary care.
The hospital works closely with the Brain Injury Association of Colorado, and is also a founder and supporter of the Rocky Mountain Stroke Association.
Spalding has the largest number of staff of any organization to achieve certification from the American Academy for the Certification of Brain Injury Specialists (AACBIS).
Spalding Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Services (JCAHO) as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Alfred I. DuPont Hospital for Children at Nemours
properties.description:
The Division of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation at the Alfred I. DuPont Hospital for Children at Nemours provides rehabilitation for both spinal cord and brain injury patients up to the age of 17. Each child’s program is individually tailored, and is designed to ensure that the child returns to the maximum amount of independence at school, at home, and in the community.
Augmentative Communication, Child Life, Occupational Therapy, Rehabilitation Engineering, Physical Therapy, and Speech/Language Pathology are incorporated into the program. The program uses a multidisciplinary approach, where therapists and the child’s treating physician work together.
The center also realizes the importance of the family in the child’s recovery. Parents, siblings, and other family members and friends are encouraged to take part in the treatment program by participating in education and support groups, family conferences, and counseling sessions.
The Division of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation at the Alfred I. DuPond Hospital for Children at Nemours is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Ohio State University Medical Center
properties.description:
Consistently named one of the best hospitals by U.S. News & World Report, Ohio State University Medical Center’s rehabilitation program offers a full range of services for patients who have sustained both brain and spinal cord injury. Using a multidisciplinary approach, the goal of the program is to decrease pain while also increasing function and independence.
Education and support services targeted at family and caregivers promotes a team approach in which all treatment plans are individualized based upon the patient’s specific injuries and needs.
Ohio State University Medical Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Mount Sinai Hospital
properties.description: Mount Sinai Hospital offers a residential program to patients with brain and spinal cord injury.  The Brain Injury and Stroke Program accepts patients at all levels, from those who are in a coma to those who have higher levels of functioning. The Spinal Cord Injury Program accepts patients with all levels of injury. Using an interdisciplinary team, each patient program is individualized according to the patient’s needs.  Mount Sinai Hospital is designated by the NIDRR as a Model System of Care for both Traumatic Brain Injury and Spinal Cord Injury, and is the only Model System for both in New York State. It is also designated as a Research and Training Center. Mount Sinai Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: MetroHealth Rehabilitation Institute
properties.description:
MetroHealth Rehabilitation Institute, located at the MetroHealth Medical Center in Cleveland, provides services to patients with brain and spinal cord injury. The institute is affiliated with Case Western Reserve University, and is one of 14 facilities in the country designated a Spinal Cord Model System Program by NIDRR.
The institute promotes a goal-oriented approach using an interdisciplinary team focused on returning each patient to maximum function and independence. Cutting-edge research and state-of-the-art technology is a cornerstone of the program, which also partners with the Cleveland Functional Electrical Stimulation Center. A rehabilitative neighborhood called Easy Street Environments allows patients to adapt to real-life situations and includes a restaurant, stores, a bank, and sidewalks.
MetroHealth Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Southcoast Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
The Southcoast Rehabilitation Center, located at Charlton Memorial Hospital, provides inpatient care and rehabilitation for both Brain and Spinal Cord Injury.
Together with the patient’s family, an interdisciplinary team works with the patient to determine goals, then develops an individualized program to help meet those goals. Patients receive several hours of therapy each day from nurses, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, social workers, case managers, and other specialists.
Southcoast Rehabilitation Center is a member of the Partners HealthCare System, which allows it to collaborate with other rehabilitation facilities throughout Massachusetts and New Hampshire.

properties.name: The Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago
properties.description:
U.S News & World Report has named The Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago the #1 rehabilitation hospital in the United States since 1991. In addition to providing state-of-the-art care to brain and spinal cord patients, The Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago participates in research, education, and advocacy.
RIC treats patients of all ages, from children to adult. Each team is led by a physiatrist, a doctor who specializes in physical medicine and rehabilitation. Depending upon the patient’s particular needs, other specialists on the team might include rehabilitation nurses, social workers, psychologists, physical and occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, vocational counselors, respiratory therapists, and pediatric specialists.
Some things that researchers at the Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago are studying and working with are the Lokomat, a robot-like walking therapy that could, at some point, help those with paralysis learn to walk; and brain mapping, which can show how brain activity changes after injury.
The Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: University of Michigan
properties.description:
University of Michigan’s inpatient rehabilitation center focuses on treating those with spinal cord injury, calling upon a diverse interdisciplinary team comprising physiatrists, nurses, physical and occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, rehabilitation engineers, recreational therapists, social workers, and psychologists. The center focuses on patients of all ages, from pediatrics to adult, and is one of the only centers in the United States that specializes in pediatric ventilator therapy.
The center is a leader when it comes to research, and has been nationally and internationally recognized for advancing the field of spinal cord injury rehabilitation.
In addition to being consistently ranked one of the best rehabilitation facilities in the country by U.S. New & World Report, University of Michigan is also home to one of the Model Spinal Cord Injury Systems.
University of Michigan is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 325 E. Eisenhower Parkway, Ann Arbor, MI 48108-0744

properties.name: Rehabilitation Institute of Michigan
properties.description:
The Rehabilitation Institute of Michigan treats a wide variety of catastrophic injuries, including brain and spinal cord injury. The center has been awarded more than $16 million in federal and private grants for rehabilitation research, restoring function, improving quality of life, and developing new therapy techniques.
The Center for Spinal Cord Injury Recovery located at the Rehabilitation Institute of Michigan is known for its cutting-edge treatments, some of which may result in some improvement in those with spinal cord injuries.
The Brain Injury program was the first of its kind established in the Midwest, and treats more brain injury programs than any other the facility in the state. The Rehabilitation Institute of Michigan is also home to the Southeastern Michigan Traumatic Brain Injury System, and is one of only 19 Centers of Excellence for the care and treatment of patients with traumatic brain injury.
Southcoast Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Froedtert Memorial Lutheran Hospital
properties.description:
The Spinal Cord Injury Program at Froedtert Memorial Lutheran Hospital, which is a collaboration with the Medical College of Wisconsin, provides comprehensive and individual care for patients with spinal cord injury. The interdisciplinary team includes neurosurgeons, physiatrists, nurses, physical and occupational therapists, vocational counselors, speech and language pathologists, social workers, and psychologists. The patient’s family is also considered an integral part of the team.
The Spinal Cord Injury Program at Froedtert Medical Lutheran Hospital is accredited by the Commission on the Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: The Rehabilitation Institute of Kansas City
properties.description:
The Rehabilitation Institute of Kansas City provides outpatient services only to a wide variety of patients, including those with spinal cord and brain injury.
Services are available for people of all ages, and focus on helping individuals progress to their highest physical, social, and vocational potentials.
The Rehabilitation Institute of Kansas City is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF). It is also certified as a Comprehensive Outpatient Rehabilitation Facility (CORF), which makes it eligible for Medicare reimbursement for outpatient services.

properties.name: Shake-A-Leg
properties.description:
Founded in 1982, Shake-A-Leg is a non-profit organization that provides outpatient rehabilitative services to people of all ages who have experienced spinal cord injury and other disabling neurological disorders.
There are two main programs that people can participate in. The Confidence is Cool Day Camp is for children and teens, and has a mission of helping participants gain the confidence to lead the most independent life possible. The Adaptive Sailing Program is available for people of all ages, and is geared toward helping participants gain additional function and independence by pushing—and moving beyond—their own boundaries.

properties.name: Pushing Boundaries
properties.description:
Pushing Boundaries is an outpatient therapy center designed to help people with all kinds of paralysis regain function and independence. The center treats patients who are newly injured, as well as those who have been coping with their injury or illness for years and are looking for new options.
Pushing Boundaries provides a comprehensive evaluation before designing an individualized program, helps the patient set and monitor goals, and tracks progress at regular intervals. Patients have access to the latest equipment and technology.

properties.name: Frazier Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
The Frazier Rehabilitation Center comprises a 135-bed inpatient hospital at the Jewish Hospital Medical Campus, plus outpatient centers located throughout Kentucky. Frazier has both Brain Injury and Spinal Cord Injury programs, both of which serve patients of all ages. The Frazier Rehab and Neuroscience Center, where brain and spinal cord injury patients are treated, features private suites and bathrooms, therapy gyms, and multipurpose dining rooms for meals, educational purposes, and recreational activities.
The Brain Injury program treats patients at all states of recovery—from coma to mild deficits—and has a staff of clinicians that specialize in different areas of brain injury, including anoxic and hypoxic brain injury, brain injury as a result of exposure to toxins, brain tumors, and traumatic brain injury.
The Spinal Cord Medicine program treats injuries that result from injury, disease, or congenital abnormalities, using cutting-edge technologies.
Frazier Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Brooks Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Brooks Rehabilitation Hospital is a 123-bed not-for-profit hospital that provides extensive inpatient and outpatient care to individuals with both brain and spinal cord injury. In addition to adults, Brooks treats infants and children as well.
Care is individualized using a multidisciplinary team, and the high standard of care that Brooks strives for has earned it credit as one of Florida’s only state-designated treatment facilities for brain and spinal cord injuries in both children and adults. The collaborative approach makes use of a team comprised of board-certified physiatrists, nurses, and therapists. In addition the physical challenges that patients of catastrophic injury face, Brooks places equal importance to dealing with the emotional and psychological issues that patients face. Family is encouraged to be involved in all aspects of treatment. For those who graduate from inpatient rehabilitation, Brooks maintains a outpatient program that ensures the patient continues to progress.
Brooks is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Sunnyview Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description: Sunnyview Rehabilitation Hospital is a 104-bed facility that serves brain and spinal cord-injured patients of all ages, at all levels of injury. Their motto, “enriching lives through greater independence,” sums up their commitment to help all patients live the most productive and functional lives possible. Using state-of-the-art equipment and technology, Sunnyview’s program comprises occupational therapy, physical therapy, speech and hearing therapy, psychology, and counseling for both the patient and his or her family. Each patient’s program is designed to meet his or her unique needs. In addition, Sunnyview is supported by Ellis Hospital, St. Clare’s Hospital, and Albany Medical Center. Sunnyview Rehabilitation Hospital is consistently named one of the best rehabilitation facilities by U.S. News & World Report. It is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: The Rehabilitation Hospital of the Pacific
properties.description:
The only acute care medical rehabilitation center to serve both Hawaii and the Pacific, the 100-bed facility treats 8,000 patients per year with brain injury, spinal cord injury, and other injuries that require rehabilitation.
Using an interdisciplinary team of individual comprising doctors, nurses, physical therapists, occupational therapists, recreational therapists, speech/language pathologists, counselors, and psychologists, the goal is for the medical team, patient, family, and community to come together to ensure that each patient is returned to the maximum amount of function and independence possible.
The Rehabilitation Hospital of the Pacific is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: CarePartners Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
An 80-bed rehabilitation center located in Asheville, North Carolina, CarePartners treats patients with brain and spinal cord injury at all levels, from severe to mild.
Rehabilitation is undertaken at least three times a week, with a team approach that includes family members. Each treatment plan is individualized according to the patient’s specific injury and needs. In addition to more standard treatment such as physical and occupational therapy, specialized programs and therapies are also available.
CarePartners Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: HealthSouth Mid-America Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
The HealthSouth Mid-America Rehabilitation Center is an 80-bed facility that offers inpatient and outpatients services to brain and spinal cord injured patients from both Kansas and Missouri. Both programs focus on developing an individualized program that helps a patient cope, as well learn compensatory skills for now and the future.
The HealthSouth Mid-America Rehabilitation Center incorporates some of the newest technologies into its program, including the AutoAmbulator, a device designed to help patients who have difficulty walking.
The HealthSouth Mid-America Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Patricia Neal Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
Patricia Neal is a 73-bed rehabilitation facility that provides inpatient physical, occupational, recreational, behavior, and speech therapy to patients with brain and spinal cord injury. Using a combination of general education and individualized care plans, the goal of the center is to return each patient to the maximum amount of independence and function possible.
The Patricia Neal Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Baptist Rehabilitation—Germantown
properties.description:
Baptist Rehabilitation-Germantown is a 68-bed acute care facility that specializes in inpatient and outpatient services for people who have sustained brain and spinal cord injury.
Using an interdisciplinary team that includes both the patient and his or her family, the program stresses individualized treatment plans designed to help the patient adapt to his or her injury and return to the community with maximum independence.
Baptist Rehabilitation-Germantown is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is a 67-bed inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for brain and spinal cord injury patients.
The brain injury program focuses on helping patients gain maximum functional and cognitive recovery, and addresses self-sufficiency as well as how to avoid future health issues.
The spinal cord injury program uses an interdisciplinary team to establish an individual treatment plan that focuses on physical, cognitive, and emotional healing.
HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital in Albuquerque has earned the Join Commission’s Gold Seal of Approval.

properties.name: UPMC Institute for Rehabilitation and Research
properties.description: UPMC Institute for Rehabilitation and Research is a 60-bed facility that uses the latest technology to facilitate recovery from brain and spinal cord injuries. Physical, occupational, and other types of therapies are used to help patients with both kinds of injuries make the most gains possible. UPMC uses the Lokomat, a technological device that simulates walking, for patients with some forms of paralysis. In addition, the institute places a strong emphasis on research so that cures and new therapies designed to improve the lives of patients with brain and spinal cord injury are consistently being developed. UPMC Institute for Rehabilitation and Research is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Shriners Hospital for Children, Philadelphia
properties.description: Shriners Hospital for Children in Philadelphia is a 59-bed facility specifically for children with illnesses and injuries, including those with spinal cord injuries. The interdisciplinary staff includes surgeons, physiatrists, psychologists, rehabilitation nurses, physical and occupational therapists, speech and language pathologists, recreation therapists, orthotists, and teachers. Each program is individually planned depending upon the child’s specific needs, with the goal of helping every child reach maximum independence. Shriners Hospital for Children is free. Children up to the age of 18 are eligible.

properties.name: Emory University Hospital’s Center for Rehabilitation Medicine
properties.description:
Located on the Emory University Hospital Campus, the Center for Rehabilitation Medicine is a 56-bed inpatient and outpatient facility that offers treatment for adult patients who have been brain injured and spinal cord injured.
In addition to providing interdisciplinary care focused on helping patients return to their most independent, Emory’s Center for Rehabilitation Medicine is also a teaching and research facility. Patients have access to a highly skilled and experienced staff, current, cutting-edge equipment, and a wide variety of specialty services.
Emory University Hospital’s Center for Rehabilitation Medicine is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: AnMed Health Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
AnMed Health Rehabilitation Hospital provides rehabilitation services to spinal cord injured patients, as well as patients with mild brain injury, in partnership with HealthSouth. The 40-bed facility uses cutting-edge technology and an interdisciplinary team to help every individual reach his or her goals.
In addition to standard therapies such as physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and recreation therapy, specialized programs and treatments include aquatic therapy, neurodevelopmental treatment, VitalStim therapy, SaeboFlex therapy, Anodyne therapy, neuro day treatment, and Lee Silverman voice treatment.
AnMed Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO).

properties.name: Mountain Valley Regional Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description: Mountain Valley Regional Rehabilitation Hospital serves all of Central and Northern Arizona. At our state-of-the-art 40-bed acute care hospital, we specialize in rehabilitation services and medical care for patients with deficits resulting from stroke, spinal cord injury, head injury and other disabling impairments. Our staff includes physiatrists (MDs who specialize in rehabilitation medicine), nurses, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals. Our goal: to promote optimum recovery so the patient can return home safely at the highest level of function possible.In addition to inpatient care, Mountain Valley also offers outpatient therapy for improved speech and cognition, balance and mobility, and use of adaptive devices – all to help each patient function as independently as possible.Rated in the Top 10% of over 800 inpatient rehab facilities in the United States for 3 consecutive years (UDSMR), Mountain Valley Regional Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO).
properties.address: 3700 N. Windsong Drive, Prescott Valley, AZ 86314

properties.name: Medical Rehabilitation Center at Charleston Area Medical Center
properties.description:
The Medical Rehabilitation Center at Charleston Area Medical Center offers inpatient and outpatient rehabilitation services to patients with brain and spinal cord injury. In addition to access to the Charleston Area Medical Center’s 500 physicians, patients who attend the 40-bed center are treated by physiatrists who hold the Functional Independence Measure Certification.
The interdisciplinary team at the center works with the patient, as well as the patient’s family and doctor, to come up with an individualized treatment plan designed to return the patient to a maximum level of function and independence.
The Medical Rehabilitation Center at Charleston Area Medical Center is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Miami Valley Hospital Rehabilitation Institute of Ohio
properties.description:
Miami Valley Hospital Rehabilitation Institute of Ohio is a 39-bed facility that offers a wide variety of rehabilitation services, including those for brain- and spinal cord-injured patients. Each patient has access to a staff comprising physiatrists, nurses, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech pathologists, psychologists, counselors, and more.
The Spinal Cord Injury Program is focused on helping patients adjust to their injury and learn to adapt to achieve maximum independence. Issues such as skin care, respiratory care, bowel and bladder maintenance, mobility, and sexuality are addressed.
The Brain Injury Program recognizes that each injury is different, and so care is highly individualized. Physical and cognitive tests are done on each patient before an individual treatment program is established. Specialists on staff are certified by the American Academy of Brain Injury Specialists.
Miami Valley Hospital Rehabilitation Institute of Ohio is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: The William Donald Schaefer Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
The William Donald Schaefer Rehabilitation Center is located at Baltimore’s Kernan Hospital. The four-unit facility, which has 32 beds per unit, has one unit for traumatic brain injury, and another for spinal cord/multiple trauma. The center is a member of the University Rehabilitation Network, which comprises seven rehabilitation programs that are linked to each other.
Both the Traumatic Brain Injury and Spinal Cord Injury programs provide treatment for both adolescents and adults, with a focus on achieving the highest level of function and independence possible. The treatment approach is individualized, with ongoing care structured at helping the patient reach his or her goals.
The facility features bathroom and kitchen setups so that people can learn daily living skills, as well as a wide variety of therapy equipment and an aquatic pool.
The William Donald Schaefer Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: VCU Rehabilitation and Research Center
properties.description: VCU Rehabilitation and Research Center is a partnership between the Medical College of Virginia Hospital and the Virginia Commonwealth University Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. The 27-bed center provides interdisciplinary rehabilitation, education, advocacy, and research for patients with brain and spinal cord injury. The Medical Hospital of Virginia holds federal designation from NIDRR as a Model System of Care for both Brain Injury and Spinal Cord Injury. Both programs are also part of the Critical Pathway program, which handles care from the time of injury through reentry into the community. VCU Rehabilitation and Research Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Burke Rehabilitation Center
properties.description: Burke Rehabilitation Center has brain and spinal cord injury inpatient and outpatient services that focus on helping the individual reach the maximum amount of independence. The multidisciplinary program is custom-tailored for each patient, and may include physical, occupational, respiratory, speech/language and recreation therapies, as well as counseling, social work, or other needed specialty services. At Burke, therapy takes place five or six days per week. Burke also offers a wide variety of education session designed for the patient’s family, so that they may better assist in the recovery process. Burke Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Memorial Medical Center
properties.description:
Memorial Medical Center, located in Springfield, Illinois, is the only program in the area to be accredited by CARF in three program areas: comprehensive inpatient, brain injury, and spinal cord system of care.
Memorial Medical Center uses an integrative team comprising rehabilitating and consulting physicians; physical, occupational, recreational, and speech therapists; psychologists and neuropsychologists; rehabilitation nurses; social services and case managers; dieticians; and the family of the patient. Using the latest tools, technology, and knowledge, the goal of the program is to return patients to the maximum amount of function possible.
Memorial Medical Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Mayo Clinic—Rochester
properties.description:
Consistently ranked by U.S. News & World Report as one of the country’s top rehabilitation hospitals, the Mayo Clinic in Rochester provides inpatient rehabilitation services to patients with spinal cord injuries.
A team of specialists comprising surgeons, neurosurgeons, physiatrists, and other specialists work together with the patient and family to determine the kind of treatment program that will best help the patient return to maximum independence. The clinic works with approximately 200 spinal cord injury patients per year.
Mayo Clinic—Rochester is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Crotched Mountain Specialty Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Every day, Crotched Mountain Specialty Rehabilitation Hospital provides unsurpassed medical care and comprehensive rehabilitation services to children and adults throughout the Northeast who have experienced brain injuries, spinal cord injuries and other serious medical conditions.
Using a patient and family centered model of individualized care, patients receive a standard regimen of physical, occupational and speech-language therapies provided by experienced therapists Our medical and therapy staff credentials include Certified Rehabilitation Registered Nurses, Certified Neuroscience Registered Nurses, Certified Brain Injury Specialists and Wound Care Specialists. Crotched Mountain has established partnerships with acute care and tertiary care hospitals throughout New England. We work regularly with them to produce the best medical care and outcomes for patients.
The Crotched Mountain Specialty Hospital is licensed by the State of New Hampshire. Our facilities include complete rehabilitation gymnasiums, therapy and lap pools, ADL kitchens and apartments and accessible trails, pathways and gardens. Crotched Mountain's services include outpatient clinics and community programs that support patient's return to home and family.

properties.name: St. John’s Mercy Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
St. John’s Mercy Rehabilitation Hospital, which is a partnership between St. John’s Mercy Medical Center and Centerre Healthcare, provides specialized programs and facilities for patients with both brain and spinal cord injury. Using a team approach, staff at St. John’s is intent upon helping patients reach their maximum potential physically and spiritually. Each patient receives their own individualized care plan, which ensures they progress from inpatient care to outpatient care as smoothly as possible.
The facilities include training apartments that allow patients to hone everyday skills such as cooking, doing laundry, and cleaning, as well as a garden center, a therapeutic pool, and private rooms with internet and television access.
St. John’s Mercy Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 14561 North Outer Forty Road, Chesterfield, MO 63017

properties.name: Shepherd Center
properties.description:
Consistently named one of America’s best rehabilitation hospitals by U.S. News & World Report, the Shepherd Center specializes in the medical treatment, research, and rehabilitation of people with catastrophic injuries, including brain and spinal cord injury.
Shepherd focuses on highly individualized care, and claims that their program turns out independent patients with some of the best long-term outcomes in the United States. Value-added services include therapeutic recreation, patient outings, chaplaincy, assistive technology, peer support, back-to-school programs, and family programs. Specialized programs tailored to adolescents, patients with dual diagnoses (both brain and spinal cord injuries), patients on ventilators, and patients with low-level brain injuries are also available.
The Shepherd Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Rehabilitation Institute of New Orleans
properties.description:
The Rehabilitation Institute of New Orleans is located at the Jo Ellen Smith Medical Center in New Orleans, Louisiana, and provides inpatient and outpatients services to those with brain and spinal cord injury.
The Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 4444 General Meyer Ave., New Orleans, LA 70131

properties.name: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is an inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
Those who have suffered from stroke have access to specially trained staff at HealthSouth’s Stroke Rehabilitation Center of Excellence. HealthSouth hospitals that receive this designation have exceeded benchmarks in clinical programming and patient outcomes for the treatment of stroke.
HealthSouth is also known for using some of the most advanced rehabilitation technology for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
There are several HealthSouth rehabilitation facilities located throughout Texas. Brain Injury programs are located in Austin, Beaumont, Fort Worth, and Midland. Spinal Cord Injury programs are located in Austin, Beaumont, Conroe, and Fort Worth.
To find additional information on the above HealthSouth facilities in Texas, log on to HealthSouth’s website and use their “facility locator” under the “where we are” tab.
Certification and accreditation may vary according to location. Please check with the hospital administrator to determine exact certifications.

properties.name: Sierra Providence Physical Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
Sierra Providence Physical Rehabilitation Hospital provides comprehensive inpatient rehabilitation to patients who have suffered from brain and spinal cord injury. With the goal of helping each and every patient return to maximum independence, each individualized program includes diagnostic testing, case evaluation, progress evaluations, advanced technology, and education and training for both patients and family members. The center provides rehabilitation for people of all ages—from childhood through adult—and all levels and stages of injury. Bilingual services are available.
For patients who are ready to go home but still need therapy, the Lomaland Center provides outpatient services.
Sierra Providence Physical Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Walton Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Located in downtown Augusta, Georgia, Walton Rehabilitation Hospital offers both outpatient and inpatient care to adolescents and adults with both brain and spinal cord injuries. Walton’s brain injury program is the oldest program of the kind in the state of Georgia.
The center collaborates with the Medical College of Georgia, University Health System, the Augusta VA Medical Center, and the Aiken Regional Medical Centers.
In addition to providing rehabilitation for brain and spinal cord injured patients, Walton also researches and develops improved methods, procedures and devices in the field of rehabilitation through its new organization, Walton Technologies. This means that patients at Walton are surrounding by the latest technologies and equipment.
Walton Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is an inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
Those who have suffered from stroke have access to specially trained staff at HealthSouth’s Stroke Rehabilitation Center of Excellence. HealthSouth hospitals that receive this designation have exceeded benchmarks in clinical programming and patient outcomes for the treatment of stroke.
HealthSouth is also known for using some of the most advanced rehabilitation technology for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
In addition to the facility located in Columbia, another HealthSouth facility located in Florence also provides inpatient rehabilitation to brain and spinal cord injured patients, and an additional facility in Charleston provides inpatient treatment for patients with spinal cord injury.
To find additional information on the above HealthSouth facilities in South Carolina, log on to HealthSouth’s website and use their “facility locator” under the “where we are” tab.
Certification and accreditation may vary according to location. Please check with the hospital administrator to determine exact certifications.

properties.name: Roger C. Peace Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
The Roger C. Pearce Rehabilitation Center, located at the Greenville Hospital System University Medical Center, provides rehabilitative care to patients with brain and spinal cord injury. Patients at all levels and stages are treated, from mild to complex.
The Brain Injury Inpatient Program is a self-contained unit with an interdisciplinary team of doctors, nurses, therapists, and neuropsychologists, These professionals work together with the patient and his or her family to design a treatment program that is specific to the individual. The Spinal Cord Injury Program strives to help each and every patient adapt to his or her injury, with the goal of returning to the maximum amount of independence.
Roger C. Peace Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Carolinas Rehabilitation
properties.description:
Carolinas Rehabilitation provides inpatient rehabilitation services for both children and adults with brain and spinal cord injury. There are four locations—one adjacent to Carolinas Medical Center’s main campus, one at CMC-Mercy, one at Levine Children’s Hospital, and one at Carolinas Rehabilitation—Mount Holly.
The goal of the rehabilitation program is to use a team approach designed to restore each patient to his or her maximum independence. All programs are unique to the patient depending upon needs and issues.
Carolinas Rehabilitation is designated as a Spinal Cord System of Care. It is also accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Cardinal Hill Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Cardinal Hill Rehabilitation Hospital has several inpatient and outpatient facilities for brain and spinal cord injury survivors of all ages. The facility in Ft. Thomas, KY, offers care for those who need long-term acute care, while the facility in Lexington is devoted to returning patients to the maximum amount of function possible.
The Brain Injury program accommodates people of all ages, from childhood to adult, and is available to patients at any level of recover after injury, from coma to mild deficits. The Spinal Cord Injury program is a transdisciplinary program that promotes a team approach to care and recovery. Patients have access to a wide variety of specialists, who continue to evaluate and reset goals as progress is made.
Cardinal Hill Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: SSM Health Care Rehabilitation at St. Mary’s Health Center
properties.description:
SSM Rehabilitation, located at St. Mary’s Health Center in St. Louis, provides inpatient rehabilitation for survivors of both brain and spinal cord injury. The goal of both programs is to help patients achieve maximum function and independence, as well as give them the skills and confidence to live the best life possible. Patients have access to physiatry, neuropsychology, case management, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, case management, rehabilitation nursing, and pastoral care services.
SSM Health Care Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: SSM Health Care Rehabilitation at St. Joseph’s Health Center
properties.description:
SSM Rehabilitation, located at St. Joseph’s Health Center in St. Charles, provides inpatient rehabilitation for survivors of both brain and spinal cord injury. The goal of both programs is to help patients achieve maximum function and independence, as well as give them the skills and confidence to live the best life possible.
Patients have access to physiatry, neuropsychology, case management, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, case management, rehabilitation nursing, and pastoral care services.
SSM Health Care Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 300 First Capitol Drive, St. Charles, MO 63301

properties.name: Drake Center Health Alliance
properties.description:
The Drake Center Health Alliance offers long-term rehabilitative care to those who have sustained spinal cord and brain injuries, in addition to offering short-term care, assisted living services, wellness services, and outpatient services. Drake also participates in on-site research studies designed to further a cure for the injuries and illnesses they treat.
Facilities include a unique outdoor therapy area, an aquatic center, and an inpatient gym. Care suites that simulate the home environment are also available and help patient adapt to and practice everyday skills.
Drake emphasizes teamwork, and supplies an interdisciplinary group of professionals that is able to assess the patient’s needs and develop an appropriate program. Both the patient and the patient’s family are considered a part of the team.
Drake Center Health Alliance is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Bacharach Institute for Rehabilitation
properties.description:
Bacharach Institute for Rehabilitation provides extensive inpatient and outpatient services for children, adolescents, and adults with brain and spinal cord injury.
Using an interdisciplinary team focused on individualized care, Bacharach offers a wide variety of services for brain and spinal cord injured patients including patient and family conferences, support group meetings, wheelchair clinics, community reintegration, peer and group counseling, driver training, and intrathecal baclofen therapy for spasticity management.
Bacharach Institute for Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 61 West Jimmie Leeds Road, Pomona, NJ 08240

properties.name: Rehabilitation Hospital of Indiana
properties.description:
One of the largest rehabilitation hospitals in the Midwest, the Rehabilitation Hospital of Indiana offers inpatient, outpatient, and vocational rehabilitation services for adults with both spinal cord and brain injury.
In additional to a wide variety of custom-tailored rehabilitation services, Rehabilitation Hospital of Indiana also offers amenities such as a 12,000-square foot gym, and practice areas that allow patients to recreate involvement in the kitchen, bathroom, bed, and, car.
The Rehabilitation Hospital of Indiana is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Good Shepherd Penn Partners
properties.description:
Good Shepherd Penn Partners is a partnership between the University of Pennsylvania Health System and Good Shepherd Rehabilitation Network. Rehabilitation for brain and spinal cord injuries is offered via a multidisciplinary team approach. The team includes physiatrists, nurses, physical and occupational therapists, speech pathologists, psychologists, and more. Patients receive 24-hour care and at least three hours of therapy per day.
The Brain Injury Program features a self-contained brain injury unit and individual treatment plans. Families are included in the treatment plan, and are encouraged to take place in education sessions and conferences.
The Spinal Cord Injury Program, which is new the center as of 2009, focuses on a holistic approach to healing, taking into account each patient’s physical, mental, and social well-being.
Good Shepherd Penn Partners is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Magee Rehabilitation
properties.description:
Magee Rehabilitation, which is part of the Jefferson Health System at Thomas Jefferson University Hospital, offers both inpatient and outpatient care to both brain and spinal cord injury patients. The brain injury program focuses on the idea that recovery occurs in the real world, with strategies that help patients gain the most amount of function possible at home, work, school, and in their communities. An interdisciplinary team develops an individualized program for each patient.
The spinal cord injury program is one of 14 Model System Centers in the United States, and includes a renowned inpatient program, use of state-of-the-art assistive and therapeutic technology, and thoughtful reintegration services.
Magee Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: MossRehab Hospital
properties.description:
MossRehab Hospital, which is consistently named one of the best hospitals by U.S. News & World Report, offers inpatient and outpatient services to patients with both brain and spinal cord injury.
The Drucker Brain Injury Center at MossRehab, which has been designated by NIDRR as a Traumatic Brain Injury Model System, offers a wide range of services including physical and occupational therapy, speech and language therapy, recreational therapy, psychology, and counseling. The acquisition of everyday skills is one of the main goals of the program. Behavioral therapy is also stressed.
The Spinal Cord Program is geared toward people with all levels of injury, and focuses on goals such as increasing mobility, learning to deal with daily activities, and using adaptive equipment. Vocational counseling that allows the patient to return to school or work is also an important aspect of the program. A weekly support group and a peer mentoring program is available to help patients deal with the emotional stress and challenges faced by those who sustain a spinal cord injury.
MossRehab Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation
properties.description:
Consistently rated one of the best rehabilitation hospitals by U.S. News & World Report, Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation is one of the few centers in the country to receive federal designation as a Model System for both spinal cord and brain injury treatment and research.
Kessler’s Center for Spinal Cord Injury Rehabilitation provides an integrated program comprising medical, nursing, and therapy care, with each patient’s individual needs taken into consideration. Kessler has the ability to care for ventilator-dependent individuals, as well as individuals who have a concomitant brain injury.
Kessler’s Center for Brain Injury Rehabilitation is designed to provide individual care for patients at every level of recovery, and is focused on helping patients gain independence, compensate for deficits, improve physical function and mobility, and overcome psychological and social problems that result from the injury.
Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 1199 Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange, NJ 07052

properties.name: HealthSouth
properties.description:
HealthSouth Rehabilitation Center is an inpatient facility that offers a network of physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech/language pathologists, psychologists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
Those who have suffered from stroke have access to specially trained staff at HealthSouth’s Stroke Rehabilitation Center of Excellence. HealthSouth hospitals that receive this designation have exceeded benchmarks in clinical programming and patient outcomes for the treatment of stroke.
HealthSouth is also known for using some of the most advanced rehabilitation technology for both brain and spinal cord injury patients.
HealthSouth has several facilities located throughout Pennsylvania. Brain injury rehabilitation is located at the Altoona, Bellefonte, Danville, Ebensburg, Erie, Reading, and Sewickley locations.
Spinal cord injury rehabilitation is located at the Altoona, Erie, and Mechanisburg locations.
Certification and accreditation may vary according to location. Please check with the hospital administrator to determine exact certifications.

properties.name: Children’s Specialized Hospital
properties.description:
Children’s Specialized Hospital is the largest freestanding pediatric rehabilitation hospital in the United States. The hospital offers Centers of Excellence in both brain injury and spinal cord injury.
The Brain Injury Program, which was established in 1981, provides care for children of all levels of cognitive awareness, from infants to young adults up to age 21. The program focuses on returning the child to the maximum amount of function, while also taking pediatric and developmental milestones into account. The staff includes a board-certified pediatrician with specialty certification in neurodevelopmental disabilities, as well as a wide variety of specialists.
The Spinal Cord Program provides individual and complex care to children with all levels of pediatric spinal cord dysfunction, including those that are dependent upon ventilators. Each program is individually planned and carried through using a team approach that includes the patient’s family.
Children’s Specialized Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Allied Services Institute of Rehabilitation Medicine, Wilkes-Barre
properties.description:
Allied Services offers inpatient and outpatient services for people who have sustained brain and spinal cord injuries.
The Spinal Cord Injury Program, which is located at Allied Health’s Scranton location, addresses issues such as cognitive and emotional challenges, muscle strength and coordination, bowel and bladder care, respiratory issues, and spasticity.
The Brain Injury Program, which is housed at Allied Health’s John Heinz Rehab Center in Wilkes-Barre, addresses issues such as behavioral and judgment problems, cognitive challenges, confusion, memory loss, muscle weakness or paralysis, emotional issues, vision and hearing issues, and speech and language challenges.
An interdisciplinary staff is available for patients with both kinds of injuries, and will design a comprehensive yet unique program designed to return the individual to the community with as much independence and function possible.

properties.name: Younker Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
Located at Iowa Methodist Medical Center, Younker Rehabilitation Center provides rehabilitative care for patients with both brain injury and spinal cord injury.
The Brain Injury Program is specialized depending upon the individual patient and his or her needs, while the main goal of the Spinal Cord Program is to ensure that those enrolled gain the skills necessary to return to an independent and productive life.
Many of the specialists at Younker Rehabilitation Center hold advanced degrees, and more than half of their nursing staff has advanced certification in rehabilitation.
Younker Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Schwab Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
Schwab Rehabilitation Centers, which has offered rehabilitation services for 90 years, was the Midwest’s first hospital of its kind. Today it offers both inpatient and outpatient care for a variety of conditions, including brain and spinal cord injury.
The Brain Injury program is highly individualized, with the goal for all patients being to return to maximum independence. The Brain Injury program also features a “New Focus” vocational program, which is designed to help brain injury patients build on their previous skills and return to work.
The Spinal Cord center features a diverse group of specialists, all of whom work together to help patients return to maximum function, address new physical needs, and ensure that each patient has the best quality of life possible.
In addition to frequently being on the U.S. World & News list of best hospitals, Scwab Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
A teaching hospital of the Harvard Medical School, Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital has been consistently ranked a top rehabilitation hospital by U.S. News & World Report. The hospital offers six major inpatient programs in rehabilitation, including one in brain injury and one in spinal cord injury.
The Brain Injury Program serves those with open and closed injuries, anoxic and apoxic injuries, as well as injuries that have resulted from illnesses. The center treats patients with a wide variety of injury levels, from coma to mild deficits.
The Spinal Cord Injury Program treats spinal cord injuries that result from both accident and injury, with a focus on teaching patients how to physically and mentally cope in the community. Patients are responsible for directing and performing their own care.
Spaulding is a member of the Partners HealthCare System, allowing it to collaborate with other rehabilitation facilities throughout Massachusetts and New Hampshire.
Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Iowa Spine and Brain Institute
properties.description:
Part of the Wheaton Franciscan Healthcare System, the Iowa Spine and Brain Institute has an inpatient rehabilitation unit focused on returning patients to independence, both physically and mentally. Individual treatment plans are developed by the staff at the Institute, many of which access affiliated Covenant Medical Center and Sports Injury and Wellness Center.
Iowa Spine and Brain Institute is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 2710 St. Francis Drive, Suite 110, Waterloo, IA 50702

properties.name: Northeast Rehabilitation Center
properties.description:
Northeast Rehabilitation Center provides inpatient rehabilitation for patients with spinal cord injury, as well as those with brain injury. Using a progressive approach that focuses on a succession of therapeutic services, the center strives to return each patient to the maximum amount of function and independence possible.
Using individual programs for each patient, a multidisciplinary staff can also help patients cope with the educational, vocational, recreational, and financial impacts of disability by teaching them adaptation skills. Family members are considered a key part of the rehabilitation team, and the center provides overnight accommodations to parents of adolescents who are in treatment.
Northeast Rehabilitation Center is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Mary Free Bed Rehabilitation Hospital
properties.description:
The Mary Free Rehabilitation Hospital, which provides inpatient care for both brain and spinal cord injury patients, is one of the few hospitals in the country still owned and operated by a women’s group.
The staff comprises doctors, nurses, and a wide variety of specialized therapists, all of whom work together to develop individualized programs for each patient depending upon their needs. Patients also benefit from state-of-the-art equipment and a therapy gym.
The hospital’s Continuum of Care philosophy ensures that patients receive life-long support after being discharged from the inpatient clinic. Follow-up care is specifically with the patient’s treatment team, allowing for the best possible future results.
Mary Free Bed Rehabilitation Hospital is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).

properties.name: Fletcher Allen Health Care
properties.description:
Fletcher Allen Healthcare provides inpatient services to patients with brain injury and spinal cord injury. The program staff comprises an interdisciplinary team of doctors, rehabilitation nurses, physical and occupational therapists, speech and language pathologists, recreational therapists, social workers, and psychologists.
Fletcher Allen Health Care is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO).

properties.name: Gillette Children’s Specialty Healthcare Center for Pediatric Rehabilitation
properties.description:
Gillette Children’s Specialty Healthcare Center for Pediatric Rehabilitation provides specialty rehabilitation and care for children with both brain and spinal cord injury. The center is the region’s largest pediatric rehabilitation program.
Individualized programs are designed using an interdisciplinary team, with the main focus on developing and meeting specific goals. Parents and family members are an integral part of the treatment team, which is there to assist beyond the inpatient stage with mobility and adaptive equipment needs, home or school modifications, and outpatient therapy.
Gillette Children’s Specialty Healthcare Center for Pediatric Rehabilitation is accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), as well as the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF).
properties.address: 200 East University Avenue, St. Paul, MN 55101
